intro: Baillieria erosa, commonly known as the common baillieria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Baillieria erosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in wet or moist environments.
